Implying that around 51-52% win rate is completely due to the patch and is ALSO a broken value? I smell salty ADC main {{champion:22}} (Lux hovers at 55% constantly {{champion:99}} )

Im not implying its due to the patch. I'm stating their current win rates are over 50% and implying they will increase to undesirable levels due to the new AD item.

Im a mid laner and ADC is my least played position, i think you should have your nose checked.

i am aware of Lux's OP winrate, but didn't think it had much relevance to the implementation of an 'AD' 'Assassin' item. When she is an 'AP' 'Caster' so i didn't mention it here, i apologise for my error of judgement.

Didn't mean to be so crude my bad.. Just happy that riot gave some love to my main champions :) Just recently AD assassins have been fairly weaker and harder to carry with in high elos compared to AP laners

Dusk is a horrible item for ADC. Im a MId main with secondary ADC but i play ADC more. And i tried all ADC champs (i own them all) with dusk and only found it works well on Varus, Vayne and Luci. And even then it gimped my damage as i had less crit rate on all those champs. 

Seriously still the best item build for ADC is crit over just dmg based items. Maybe you can get this over dusk if you aren't planing on getting a def item, but even then i would advise against it. Dusk is more for Melee bruisers top or maybe some jungles could use it and of course assassins.
I have never bought it on an adc and likely never will, whats your point?
I think i posted on the wrong message sorry. I re read what you said and it makes no sense as to why i would say that to YOU. Sorry.
When will hex-Tech crafting be available??? Really looking forward to it!

Definitely in 2016 =P

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
How about an ad/armour item for ad carries? To help deal with the insane amount of ad assassins in solo q.
I'm not sure if it was their intent, but deaths dance does have the anti-burst effect that may have been designed as a general anti assassin item.

Plus the whole idea of an assassin is to be a threat of 1-shot. As a super-squishy (like an adc) you are forced to sit back until the assassin has burned his cooldowns, even as the assassin is saving them for you. Basically your team 4v4s while the adc and assassin have a mini-game of chicken. If you take that 1-shot away from assassins they can't do their job but an adc could still do his/hers.

Think of it like this:

An adc is a deathstar and an assassin is Luke Skywalker. You are a monster of destruction with a very clear and obvious weakness. Your positioning is everything. If you mis-position (Like walk in before the assassin uses his abilities) you durped and he/she punished, plain and simple.
You can't milk those
{{champion:12}}
When are we getting the new champion select for normals???? I'm literally only leveling to 30 so I can play the new champion select.
please release a new ekko skin{{champion:245}}

I think I hear Zed players drooling & laughing
{{champion:238}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:238}}  *hah hah hah hah hah hah hah hah haa*

I don't really like AD assassins myself but if I WERE someone who liked to play them, I'd personally like the Nightfall passive on the Duskblade to be an active rather than passive. Say a tank jumps on me; I still want to auto him (But not necessarily kill him for the reset) but save my abilities and burst (including Nightfall) for when I can go in on the squishies.

Thats why its a passive and not an active, so that you have to position well and use it properly for it to be useful. if it were an active it would be way too easy to just drop on the squishies when they are low

its pretty terrifying to see this item released into the wilderness without any real balance changes to obvious outliers, and in most cases many of the champs who will abuse this item dont _need_ any help in the first place.
I completely support the item and itemization for AD assassins, but only if champs are balanced around it.

Not looking forward to this patch :/
Have you ever heard of {{item:3157}} for AP or {{item:3139}} for AD? Unless you're referring to tanks needing something to counter it, in which case, what are you on?

This update is ridiculous in general and AD assassins never needed any help, even after the nerfs to champs such as Zed.
If you think they did, then something's wrong with you. 

There's a reason why Zhonya's not being rushed anymore kid, it's way too expensive as a first item. By the time you even get it, they would already be picking off kills off snowballing. 
Same case for QSS, even as a fairly cheap item, it's not something an ADC should be rushing.

So now every single person can land the alistair combo very easily? Correct me if I'm wrong but just how much counter play does his combo have? (very little I think) Bot lane is going to be a nightmare now. Thanks rito
I main Alistar as support and I actually had to practice to being to do the W+Q combo perfectly now everyone is going to be able to do the combo easily T_T
lol it was not that hard u just push w and then q... now its the same, just people with only 1 finger can still manage it.

Plz Rito, think about us poor supports
Also, bring back ranked 5's, can't play with some of my friends because you didn't put it in.
duskblade is a supp item, just slap it on anybody

So I guess riot is really hating on {{item:1401}} right now. {{item:3068}} is now twice as efficient at clearing camps for only and extra 175 gold.

Can i be honest riot. I know you would think im joking but listen. In late game tanks or who am i kidding adc's can tank on a tower and take it down before dying epecially tanks. And now you added something that burns towers aswell.This is going the wrong way (LOL is going to die soon). Except early to mid game the towers go down incredibly fast (you guys are talking about making this game fair and to make teams be able to come back). I truly believe you guys have made an error that you simply want to put aside.SAD.
A DoT burn effect is not going to help heaps when trying to take down a tower quickly. Also, I don't think ADCs could tank a tower except for half a dozen hits (otherwise - what are they building?!)
